com.scalar.db.sql

Interface Record

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ColumnsRecord, ResultRecord, SingleColumnRecord

    public interface Record
    A record of a database.

      • getBoolean

        boolean getBoolean(java.lang.String columnName)
        Returns the BOOLEAN value of the specified column as a Java boolean type.

        Note that, due to its signature, this method cannot return null. If the value is NULL, it will return 0. If this doesn't work for you, either call isNull(String) before calling this method, or use getAsObject(String) instead.

        Parameters:
        columnName - a column name of the value
        Returns:
        the BOOLEAN value of the specified column as a Java boolean type

      • getAsObject

        @Nullable
java.lang.Object getAsObject(java.lang.String columnName)
        Returns the value of the specified column as a Java Object type.

        If the columns is a BOOLEAN type, it returns a Boolean object. If the columns is an INT type, it returns an Integer object. If the columns is a BIGINT type, it returns a LONG object. If the columns is a FLOAT type, it returns a FLOAT object. If the columns is a DOUBLE type, it returns a DOUBLE object. If the columns is a TEXT type, it returns a String object. If the columns is a BLOB type, it returns a ByteBuffer object.

        Parameters:
        columnName - a column name of the value
        Returns:
        the value of the specified column as a Java Object type. If the value is NULL, null

      • getAsObject

        @Nullable
java.lang.Object getAsObject(int i)
        Returns the value of the i-th column as a Java Object type.

        If the columns is a BOOLEAN type, it returns a Boolean object. If the columns is an INT type, it returns an Integer object. If the columns is a BIGINT type, it returns a LONG object. If the columns is a FLOAT type, it returns a FLOAT object. If the columns is a DOUBLE type, it returns a DOUBLE object. If the columns is a TEXT type, it returns a String object. If the columns is a BLOB type, it returns a ByteBuffer object.

        Parameters:
        i - the position of the column
        Returns:
        the value of the specified column as a Java Object type. If the value is NULL, null
